conclusion: Use Faraday's Law of Induction to find potential difference.
Faraday's Law: Induced emf is negative rate of change of magnetic flux.
Magnetic flux is product of magnetic field and area.
Side length of square is 0.2 m; half is in magnetic field.
Area of square in magnetic field is 0.02 mÂ².
Rate of change of magnetic flux is 0.2 Wb/s.
Potential difference between points a and b is 0.1 V.
